glsa.title: Pixman: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in Pixman might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: Pixman is a pixel manipulation library.

description.p: In pixman-general, careless computations done with the ‘dest_buffer’ pointer may overflow, failing the buffer upper limit check.

impact.p: A remote attacker could possibly cause a Denial of Service condition, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Pixman users should upgrade to the latest version:
